head.title: Work of Three Wyeths In Newport News, Va.

identified-content.org: Peninsula Fine Arts Center (Newport News, Va)

hedline.hl1: Work of Three Wyeths In Newport News, Va.

abstract.p: Peninsula Fine Arts Center in Newport News, Va, opens exhibition of works by N C, Andrew and Jamie Wyeth; photo (S)

block.p: An art museum in Newport News, Va., has mounted a triple exhibition of the works of the three Wyeths -- N. C., Andrew and Jamie.

The museum, the Peninsula Fine Arts Center, is showing 15 oil paintings by N. C. Wyeth, one of the country's best known illustrators in the early part of the century. One of the paintings, depicting King Arthur, is typical of his work, having been used as a cover illustration of a children's book.
An art museum in Newport News, Va., has mounted a triple exhibition of the works of the three Wyeths -- N. C., Andrew and Jamie.

The museum, the Peninsula Fine Arts Center, is showing 15 oil paintings by N. C. Wyeth, one of the country's best known illustrators in the early part of the century. One of the paintings, depicting King Arthur, is typical of his work, having been used as a cover illustration of a children's book.
N. C. Wyeth's son Andrew, now 83, is represented by 14 works -- watercolors, pencil and tempera -- including scenes from the area that has been home to all the Wyeths, Chadds Ford, Pa.

The youngest Wyeth painter, Jamie, 54, a son of Andrew's, has 19 pieces in the show, including an oil portrait of Andy Warhol and a series of 14 illustrations from Elizabeth Seabrook's ''Cabbages and Kings.''

The Peninsula Arts Center is at 101 Museum Drive in the Mariners Museum Park in Newport News, two and a half miles from Exit 258A of Interstate 64; (757) 596-8175. Admission is $4, $2 ages 4 to 15. The museum is open 10 a.m. to 5 p.m. Monday to Saturday, 1 to 5 p.m. on Sunday. The Wyeth show runs until Sept. 7.
